intro: Sampera ecuadoriensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian sampera, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Sampera ecuadoriensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
